program_information.program_name_citation: The question of food subsidies seem-s to be at the forefront of nearly all discussion of macroeconomic adjustment in developing countries
program_information.target_population_citation: When faced with the charge that the food (and fuel) subsidies present excessive budgetary exposure, and are responsible for a large part of the fiscal deficit, many LDC governments reply that a reduction of subsidies would seriously affect their poverty alleviation objectives

study_characteristics.outcomes_evidence_citation: What is the optimal pattern of food subsidies, under budgetary constraints, when the objective is poverty minimisation?
study_characteristics.design_evidence_citation: Our task has been to formulate the problem of the optimal pattern of food subsidies within the framework of the modern public finance literature

bonus_information.cost_mentions: Discussion of budgetary constraints and fiscal deficits
bonus_information.cost_evidence_citation: When faced with the charge that the food (and fuel) subsidies present excessive budgetary exposure, and are responsible for a large part of the fiscal deficit
